alert.note: Alert for Catawba; Cleveland; Greater Burke; Greater Caldwell; Lincoln (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 3:08PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Catawba, northwestern Lincoln, southeastern Caldwell, northwestern Cleveland and southeastern Burke Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 308 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles southeast of Lenoir to 7 miles west of Hickory to 14 miles northwest of Shelby. Movement was northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hickory, St. Stephens, Longview, Sawmills, Granite Falls, Icard, Hildebran, Connelly Springs, Rutherford College and Rhodhiss. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Catawba; Cleveland; Greater Burke; Greater Caldwell; Lincoln
